status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: http://omegabiotek.com/store/product/e-z-n-a-microelute-dna-clean-up-kit/
components.name: Description

source_data.description: http://omegabiotek.com/store/product/e-z-n-a-microelute-dna-clean-up-kit/

components.data: DNeasy®  Blood &  Tissue kit ((www.qiagen.com/handbooks)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: DNeasy®  Blood &  Tissue kit ((www.qiagen.com/handbooks)

components.data: RNeasy®  Min  kit ((www.qiagen.com/handbooks)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: RNeasy®  Min  kit ((www.qiagen.com/handbooks)

components.data: Thermal cycling conditions were as follows:
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Thermal cycling conditions were as follows:

components.data: 95°C for 2 min an initial denaturation step,
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 95°C for 2 min an initial denaturation step,

components.data: then 35 cycles at 95°C for 1 min denaturation,
components.name: Description

source_data.description: then 35 cycles at 95°C for 1 min denaturation,

components.data: 55-60°C for 1 min annealing,
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 55-60°C for 1 min annealing,

components.data: 72°C for 1 min extension,
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 72°C for 1 min extension,

components.data: 72°C for 5 min final extension and
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 72°C for 5 min final extension and

components.data: at 4°C for every holding tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: at 4°C for every holding tube.

components.data: Standard qPCR profile for CNV detections and gene expression
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Standard qPCR profile for CNV detections and gene expression

components.data: Initial Denaturation: The reaction temperature is increased to 95 °C and the sample is incubated for 1 min (the time depends on the polymerase enzyme hot start mechanism) to ensure that all complex targets (dsDNA) are separated and are single stranded and available for amplification.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Initial Denaturation: The reaction temperature is increased to 95 °C and the sample is incubated for 1 min (the time depends on the polymerase enzyme hot start mechanism) to ensure that all complex targets (dsDNA) are separated and are single stranded and available for amplification.

components.data: Denaturation: The reaction temperature is increased to 95 °C for 10 sec to melt all dsDNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Denaturation: The reaction temperature is increased to 95 °C for 10 sec to melt all dsDNA.

components.data: Annealing: The temperature is lowered to 60 °C for 30 sec to promote primer and probe (if included) binding to the template.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Annealing: The temperature is lowered to 60 °C for 30 sec to promote primer and probe (if included) binding to the template.

components.data: Extension: 68°C for 10 s. Duration of extension was dependent upon amplicon size (30 sec per 1 kb). The period of elongation depends upon the desired length of the amplicon and the enzyme used. Since qPCR amplicons are short, this is typically 5–30 sec.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Extension: 68°C for 10 s. Duration of extension was dependent upon amplicon size (30 sec per 1 kb). The period of elongation depends upon the desired length of the amplicon and the enzyme used. Since qPCR amplicons are short, this is typically 5–30 sec.

components.data: TRIzol® Reagent
components.name: Description

source_data.description: TRIzol® Reagent

components.data: Chloroform
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Chloroform

components.data: Isopropyl alcohol
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Isopropyl alcohol

components.data: 75% ethanol
components.name: Description

source_data.description: 75% ethanol

components.data: RNase free water
components.name: Description

source_data.description: RNase free water

components.data: Determine your sample type, and perform homogenization at room temperature according to the table below. The sample volume should not exceed 10% of the volume of TRIzol® Reagent used for homogenization. Be sure to use the indicated amount of TRIzol® Reagent, because an insufficient volume can result in DNA contamination of isolated RNA.Phase separation
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Determine your sample type, and perform homogenization at room temperature according to the table below. The sample volume should not exceed 10% of the volume of TRIzol® Reagent used for homogenization. Be sure to use the indicated amount of TRIzol® Reagent, because an insufficient volume can result in DNA contamination of isolated RNA.Phase separation

components.data: Incubate the homogenized sample (see Homogenizing samples) for 5 minutes at room temperature to permit complete dissociation of the nucleoprotein complex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate the homogenized sample (see Homogenizing samples) for 5 minutes at room temperature to permit complete dissociation of the nucleoprotein complex.

components.data: Add 0.2 mL of chloroform per 1 mL of TRIzol® Reagent used for homogenization. Cap the tube securely.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.2 mL of chloroform per 1 mL of TRIzol® Reagent used for homogenization. Cap the tube securely.

components.data: Shake tube vigorously by hand for 15 seconds.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Shake tube vigorously by hand for 15 seconds.

components.data: Incubate for 2–3 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate for 2–3 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Centrifuge the sample at 12,000 × g for 15 minutes at 4°C.Note: The mixture separates into a lower red phenol-chloroform phase, an interphase, and a colorless upper aqueous phase. RNA remains exclusively in the aqueous phase. The upper aqueous phase is ~50% of the total volume.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the sample at 12,000 × g for 15 minutes at 4°C.Note: The mixture separates into a lower red phenol-chloroform phase, an interphase, and a colorless upper aqueous phase. RNA remains exclusively in the aqueous phase. The upper aqueous phase is ~50% of the total volume.

components.data: Remove the aqueous phase of the sample by angling the tube at 45° and pipetting the solution out. Avoid drawing any of the interphase or organic layer into the pipette when removing the aqueous phase.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the aqueous phase of the sample by angling the tube at 45° and pipetting the solution out. Avoid drawing any of the interphase or organic layer into the pipette when removing the aqueous phase.

components.data: Place the aqueous phase into a new tube and proceed to the RNA Isolation Procedure.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place the aqueous phase into a new tube and proceed to the RNA Isolation Procedure.

components.data: Save the interphase and organic phenol-chloroform phase if isolation of DNA or protein is desired. See DNA Isolation Procedure and Protein Isolation Procedure for details. The organic phase can be stored at 4°C overnight.RNA Isolation ProcedureAlways use the appropriate precautions to avoid RNase contamination when preparing and handling RNA.RNA precipitation
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Save the interphase and organic phenol-chloroform phase if isolation of DNA or protein is desired. See DNA Isolation Procedure and Protein Isolation Procedure for details. The organic phase can be stored at 4°C overnight.RNA Isolation ProcedureAlways use the appropriate precautions to avoid RNase contamination when preparing and handling RNA.RNA precipitation

components.data: (Optional) When precipitating RNA from small sample quantities (<106 cells or <10 mg tissue), add 5–10 μg of RNase-free glycogen as a carrier to the aqueous phase.Note: Glycogen is co-precipitated with the RNA, but does not inhibit first-strand synthesis at concentrations ≤4 mg/mL, and does not inhibit PCR.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: (Optional) When precipitating RNA from small sample quantities (<106 cells or <10 mg tissue), add 5–10 μg of RNase-free glycogen as a carrier to the aqueous phase.Note: Glycogen is co-precipitated with the RNA, but does not inhibit first-strand synthesis at concentrations ≤4 mg/mL, and does not inhibit PCR.

components.data: Add 0.5 mL of 100% isopropanol to the aqueous phase, per 1 mL of TRIzol® Reagent used for homogenization.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.5 mL of 100% isopropanol to the aqueous phase, per 1 mL of TRIzol® Reagent used for homogenization.

components.data: Incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes.

components.data: Centrifuge at 12,000 × g for 10 minutes at 4°C.Note: The RNA is often invisible prior to centrifugation, and forms a gel-like pellet on the side and bottom of the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 12,000 × g for 10 minutes at 4°C.Note: The RNA is often invisible prior to centrifugation, and forms a gel-like pellet on the side and bottom of the tube.

components.data: Proceed to RNA wash.RNA wash
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Proceed to RNA wash.RNA wash

components.data: Remove the supernatant from the tube, leaving only the RNA pellet.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the supernatant from the tube, leaving only the RNA pellet.

components.data: Wash the pellet, with 1 mL of 75% ethanol per 1 mL of TRIzol® Reagent used in the initial homogenization.Note: The RNA can be stored in 75% ethanol at least 1 year at –20°C, or at least 1 week at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash the pellet, with 1 mL of 75% ethanol per 1 mL of TRIzol® Reagent used in the initial homogenization.Note: The RNA can be stored in 75% ethanol at least 1 year at –20°C, or at least 1 week at 4°C.

components.data: Vortex the sample briefly, then centrifuge the tube at 7500 × g for 5 minutes at 4°C. Discard the wash.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vortex the sample briefly, then centrifuge the tube at 7500 × g for 5 minutes at 4°C. Discard the wash.

components.data: Vacuum or air dry the RNA pellet for 5–10 minutes. Do not dry the pellet by vacuum centrifuge.Note: Do not allow the RNA to dry completely, because the pellet can lose solubility. Partially dissolved RNA samples have an A260/280 ratio <1.6.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Vacuum or air dry the RNA pellet for 5–10 minutes. Do not dry the pellet by vacuum centrifuge.Note: Do not allow the RNA to dry completely, because the pellet can lose solubility. Partially dissolved RNA samples have an A260/280 ratio <1.6.

components.data: Proceed to RNA resuspension.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Proceed to RNA resuspension.

components.data: RNase Free dH2O                                                         1 ml x 2
